forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 55. West southwest wind 7 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 6 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
As the evening deepens in Downtown San Francisco, a gentle layer of clouds embraces the twisted skyline, casting a soft, muted glow over the city's iconic silhouette. The temperature, whispering around 55 degrees, tugs at your senses with a cool breeze that dances in from the west southwest. The unrelenting winds, reaching up to 20 mph, create a lively rustle in the trees and a subtle reminder that nature holds her own cadence. For those bracing against the night, a light jacket will offer both warmth and comfort against the Pacific’s tender kiss.

As dawn breaks tomorrow, the city will awaken to a more vibrant scene. Mostly sunny conditions will prevail as the sun stretches its arms, promising a high near 65 that tenderly graces the afternoon with a mild drop to around 62. The winds will mellow slightly, yet a playful breeze will still linger, ideal for a leisurely stroll through the Mission District or a visit to one of the many cozy cafés lining the streets. The beauty of the day emanates an invitation—embrace the simple pleasures of walking along the waterfront or perhaps diving into the eclectic ambiance of local shops. Dress in layers; a light cardigan over a short-sleeved shirt will be both practical and stylish in this temperate embrace, allowing you to bask in the unfolding beauty of a quintessential San Francisco day.
